instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message:
2523 intermittent green light
u6990 shorted,
u6990 replaced with one from an 820-2877 (same pinout)
output pin 4 now is 3.42V
ppbus 12.61
i think the problem may be smc communication?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message:
Crap under SMC/around U7000? Known good magsafe board? SMC_BC_ACOK?
If U6990 was really shorted there would be no green light at all.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: smc clear, u7000 clear, known good, SMC_BC_ACOK 3.374V@R6929, agreed, changed adapters now have green light, no change to other symptoms

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: You didn't mention any other symptoms.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: sorry, there isnt any, what would you look for next?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message:
Intermittent meaning green light stops randomly or it's blinking?

Since U6990 was shot, nothing funky in this area? D6990 and resistors.Traces for onewire circuit.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: there is no D6990 on this board, i think green light was the charger or dc-in board, but it didnt change anything

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: You start the topic by saying no green light. Then it has a green light and ask for more advice? What is the problem, green light was fixed. Use 85W charger and need to short power pads on these boards.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: green light is on, but the problem is still not fixed, what do you want me to say?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message:
[QUOTE="peterfixit, post: 19457"]there is no D6990 on this board, i think green light was the charger or dc-in board, but it didnt change anything[/QUOTE]

Maybe another D6xxx label on this old C2D board. I don't have the schematic but pretty sure if you look pp3v42 power supply circuit you will find a dual switching mode diode. But if you fixed green light, it s not anymore relevant.

If intermittent green light is fixed, and you are using 85w charger and you short SMC_ONOFF_L pads or use a keyboard to power on the board and it still doesn't power on, then it's time to check further power rails.

What about C7771 output voltage?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: What problem? Original post only mentions green light issue.....

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: ok, the problem is no power, not turning on

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: Since you changed the adapter, is it a REAL ORIGINAL 85W one? Battery charging? Does it power off a charged battery? Must short power pads on these boards.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: yes genuine 85w charger, no battery to test with but power at battery connector is 0.15v on ppvbatt, on q7035 i get 15v on input and 0.6v on output but is not shorted to ground, smc_onoff_L does nothing

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: P3v3_s5? Smc_adapter_en?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: p3v3_s5 at c7750 is 3.3v   smc_adapter_en 3.395v at r5085

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: Voltage at C7771? PWRBTN_L toggling if you short power pad?

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: 1.070V at c7771 I cant find TP[1]PM_PWRBTN_L, the tp doesnt line up with anything on the boardview , the only other places it goes is under the cpu and smc

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: Landrex gives me probe 1083 right on the other side of the SMC.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: rtg is 27.93k/0.931V when high, 26.96k/0.914V when low

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: No idea what you mean. I asked if the signal toggles when you press the power button.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: and im not sure exactly what you mean, i dont have a scope, all i can tell you is something happens on that line when the smc_onoff_L pads are shorted, so im giving you the resistance to ground and diode mode to ground on the test point

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: You should not measure resistance or diode with power applied. You should clearly be able to see the voltage drop and come back when you press power button.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: i did see that

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: Just out of interest... Did you happen to buy your "genuine" charger from Amazon or eBay? I bought 4 chargers from these fuckers 2 of which died and 1 would not power a board without battery. At least one of them works. They all have a lovely Apple logo on them and all say 85W and look the part but they don't do what they should.

threads.title: 820-2523 super strange problem
threads.message: Get a charged battery and see if it charges and powers on from that.
